definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN
node to the target NG-RAN node to request the preparation of resources for a
handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node → target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target Cell Global ID
elementList.description: Includes either an E-UTRA CGI or an NR CGI

elementList.name: NG-C UE associated Signalling reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the AMF on the source NG-C connection.

elementList.name: Signalling TNL association address at source NG-C side
elementList.description: This IE indicates the AMF s IP address of the SCTP association used at the source NG-C interface instance. Note: If no UE TNLA binding exists at the source NG-RAN node, the source NG-RAN node indicates the TNL association address it would have selected if it would have had to create a UE TNLA binding.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List
elementList.description: Similar to NG-C signalling, containing UL tunnel information per PDU Session Resource; and in addition, the source side QoS flow DRB mapping

elementList.name: RRC Context
elementList.description: Either includes the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 10.2.2. of TS 36.331 [14], if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB.

elementList.name: Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting.

elementList.name: UE Context Reference at the S-NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN
node to inform the source NG-RAN node about the prepared resources at the
target.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node → source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources Not Admitted List
Target NG-RAN node To Source NG-RAN node Transparent Container
elementList.description: Either includes the HandoverCommand message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [14], if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverCommand message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB.

elementList.name: DRBs transferred to MN
elementList.description: In case of DC, indicates that SN Status is needed for the listed DRBs from the S-NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN
node to inform the source NG-RAN node that the Handover Preparation has failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node → source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: SN STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN
node to the target NG-RAN node to transfer the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status during a handover or for dual connectivity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node → target NG-RAN node(handover), NG-RAN node from which the DRB context is transferred → NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred (RRC connection re-establishment or dual connectivity).

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node and for dual connectivity at the NG-RAN node from which the DRB context is transferred.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node and for dual connectivity at the NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer List

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN
node to the source NG-RAN node to indicate that resources can be released.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node → source NG-RAN node, M-NG-RAN node → S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node or for dual connectivity at the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node or for dual connectivity at the M-NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER CANCEL
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN
node to the target NG-RAN node to cancel an ongoing handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node → target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: RAN PAGING
descriptionList: This message is sent by the NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to page a UE.

elementList.name: Index Length-10
elementList.description: Coded as specified in TS 38.304 [33] and TS 36.304 [34].

elementList.name: Paging DRX
elementList.description: Includes the RAN paging cycle as defined in TS 36.304 [34] and 38.304 [33].

elementList.name: UE specific DRX
elementList.description: Includes the UE specific paging cycle as defined in TS 36.304 [34] and 38.304 [33].

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the new NG-RAN node
to request the old NG-RAN node to transfer the UE Context to the new NG-RAN.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node → old NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Integrity protection
elementList.description: RRC Resume: ResumeMAC-I either contained in the RRC ResumeRequest or the RRCResumeRequest1 message as defined in TS 38.331 [10]) or the ShortResumeMAC-I in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [14]) RRC Reestablishment: ShortMAC-I contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest as defined in TS 38.331 [10]) or the ShortMAC-I in the RRCConnection ReestablishmentRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [14]).

elementList.name: New Cell Identifier
elementList.description: RRC Resume: Corresponds to the targetCellIdentity within the VarResumeMAC-Input as specified in TS 38.331 [10] or the cellIdentity within the VarShortINACTIVE-MAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [14]. RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to the targetCellIdentity within the VarShortMAC-Input as specified in TS 38.331 [10] or the cellIdentity within the VarShortMAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: RRC Resume Cause
elementList.description: In case of RNA Update, contains the cause value provided by the UE in the RRCResumeRequest or the RRCResumeRequest1 message, as defined in TS 38.331 [10], or in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message, as defined in TS 36.331 [14].

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the old NG-RAN node
to transfer the UE context to the new NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old NG-RAN node → new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node

elementList.name: UE Context Information Retrieve UE Context Response
Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting.

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the old NG-RAN node
to inform the new NG-RAN node that the Retrieve UE Context procedure has
failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old NG-RAN node → new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node To New NG-RAN node Resume Container
elementList.description: Includes either the RRCRelease message as defined in TS 38.331 [10], or the RRCConnectionRelease message as defined in TS 36.331 [14], encapsulated in a PDCP-C PDU.

definitionList.name: XN-U ADDRESS INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is either sent by the new
NG-RAN node to transfer data forwarding information to the old NG-RAN node, or
by the M-NG-RAN node to provide either data forwarding or Xn-U bearer address
information for SN terminated bearers to the S-NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node → old NG-RAN node, M-NG-RAN node → S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Xn-U Address Information per PDU Session Resources List
Xn-U Address Information per PDU Session Resources Item
Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node
elementList.reference: Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node 9.2.1.16

elementList.name: Secondary Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node List
elementList.description: This IE would be present only when the target M-NG-RAN node decide to split a PDU session between MN and SN

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Setup Complete Info SN terminated
DRB IDs taken into use
elementList.description: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of PDU sessions. Value is 256

definitionList.name: S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to the S-NG-RAN node to request the preparation of
resources for dual connectivity operation for a
specific UE.

elementList.name: M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into M-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node respectively.

elementList.name: Selected PLMN
elementList.description: The selected PLMN of the SCG in the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources To Be Added List
PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item
elementList.description: NOTE: If neither the PDU Session Resource Setup Info SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Setup Info MN terminated IE is present in a PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.1.4 apply.

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.reference: PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate 9.2.3.69

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Setup Info SN terminated
PDU Session Resource Setup Info MN terminated
M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container
elementList.description: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10]

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Requested Split SRBs
elementList.description: Indicates that resources for Split SRBs are requested.

elementList.name: Available DRB IDs
elementList.description: Indicates the list of DRB IDs that the S-NG-RAN node may use for SN-terminated bearers.

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink
elementList.description: The S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink is a portion of the UE s Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate in the Uplink, which is enforced by the S-NG-RAN node for the UE s SN terminated PDU sessions. If the S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink IE is not present, this IE applies to both UL and DL.

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink
elementList.description: The S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink is a portion of the UE s Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate in the Downlink, which is enforced by the S-NG-RAN node for the UE s SN terminated PDU sessions.

elementList.name: Location Information at S-NODE reporting
elementList.description: Indicates that the user s Location Information at S-NODE is to be provided.

elementList.name: MR-DC Resource Coordination Information
elementList.description: Information used to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: SN Addition Trigger Indication
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (SN change, inter-MN HO, intra-MN HO, ...)
elementList.description: This IE indicates the trigger for S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation procedure

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of PDU sessions. Value is 256

definitionList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of DRBs containing
information about PDCP PDU transfer status.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer Item
Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12 9.2.3.36
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.3.37
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12 9.2.3.36
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target NG-RAN node (handover) or the NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred (dual connectivity) should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.3.37
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target NG-RAN node (handover) or the NG-RAN node to which the DRB context is transferred (dual connectivity) should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN

definitionList.name: Global gNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: gNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.

definitionList.name: Global ng-eNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Short Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Long Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: Global NG-RAN Node ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [9]).

definitionList.name: PLMN Identity
descriptionList: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

definitionList.name: TAC
descriptionList:
This
information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

definitionList.name: RAN Area Code
descriptionList: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

definitionList.name: NR CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

definitionList.name: E-UTRA CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

definitionList.name: NG-RAN Cell Identity
descriptionList:
This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA
Cell Identity.

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.8).

definitionList.name: NG-RAN Cell PCI
descriptionList:
This IE defines physical cell ID of
a cell served by an NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: NR PCI
elementList.description: NR Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: E-UTRA PCI
elementList.description: E-UTRA Physical Cell ID

definitionList.name: Served Cell Information NR
descriptionList:
This IE contains cell configuration
information of an NR cell that a neighbouring NG-RAN node may
need for the Xn AP interface.

elementList.name: NR-PCI
elementList.description: NR Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in SIB1 associated to the NR Cell Identity in the NR CGI IE.

elementList.name: Measurement Timing Configuration
elementList.description: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the served cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [8]. All PLMN Identities and associated information contained in the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE are included and provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in SIB1 associated to the NR Cell Identity IE

elementList.name: Configured TAC Indication
elementList.description: NOTE: This IE is associated with the TAC in the Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE

elementList.name: Configured TAC Indication
elementList.description: NOTE: This IE is associated with the TAC on top-level of the Served Cell Information NR IE

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of broadcast PLMNs by a cell. Value
  is 12.

definitionList.name: Served Cell Information E-UTRA
descriptionList:
This IE contains cell configuration
information of an E-UTRA cell that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need for the Xn
AP interface.

elementList.name: E-UTRA PCI
elementList.description: E-UTRA Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in SIB1 associated to the E-UTRA Cell Identity in the ECGI IE. NOTE: In this version of the specification, it is possible to broadcast only up to 6 PLMN IDs.

elementList.name: UL EARFCN
elementList.description: Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [25] for E-UTRA operating bands for which it is defined; ignored for E-UTRA operating bands for which NUL is not defined

elementList.name: DL EARFCN
elementList.description: Corresponds to NDL in TS 36.104 [25]
