elementList.description: Uplink-downlink subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: Special Subframe Info
elementList.description: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: Special Subframe Patterns
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, ssp9, ssp10, ...)

elementList.name: MBSFN Subframe Info
elementList.description: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [14]

elementList.name: Radioframe Allocation Period
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (n1, n2, n4, n8, n16, n32, )

elementList.name: FreqBandIndicatorPriority
elementList.description: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcast in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [14])

elementList.name: BandwidthReducedSI
elementList.description: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [14])

elementList.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List E-UTRA
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to the cellAccessRelatedInfoList-5GC IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 36.331 [14]. All PLMN Identities and associated information contained in the cellAccessRelatedInfoList-5GC IE are included and provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in SIB1 associated to the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of broadcast PLMNs by a cell. The
  value is 12.

Maximum no. of MBSFN
  frame allocation with different offset. Value is 8.

Maximum no. of PLMN Ids.broadcast in an E-UTRA
  cell. Value is 6.

definitionList.name: Neighbour Information NR
descriptionList:
This IE contains cell configuration
information of NR cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need to properly
operate its own served cells.

elementList.name: NRPCI
elementList.description: NR Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: Measurement Timing Configuration
elementList.description: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [10].

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of neighbour cells associated to a
  given served cell. Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Neighbour Information E-UTRA
descriptionList:
This IE contains
cell configuration information of E-UTRA cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may
need to properly operate its own served cells.

elementList.name: E-UTRA PCI
elementList.description: E-UTRA Physical Cell Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of neighbour cells associated to a
  given served cell. Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Served Cells To Update NR
descriptionList:
This IE contains updated configuration information
for served NR cells exchanged between NG-RAN nodes.

elementList.name: Served Cells NR To Add
elementList.description: List of added cells served by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Modify NR
elementList.description: List of modified cells served by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Deactivation Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that the concerned cell is switched off for energy saving reasons.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Delete NR
elementList.description: List of deleted cells served by the NG-RAN node.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by a
  NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: Served Cells to Update E-UTRA
descriptionList:
This IE contains updated configuration information
for served E-UTRA cells exchanged between NG-RAN nodes.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Add E-UTRA
elementList.description: List of added cells served by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Modify E-UTRA
elementList.description: List of modified cells served by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Deactivation Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that the concerned cell is switched off for energy saving reasons.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Delete E-UTRA
elementList.description: List of deleted cells served by the NG-RAN node.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by a
  NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: Cell Assistance Information NR
descriptionList:
The Cell Assistance Information IE
is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells.

elementList.name: List of Requested NR Cells
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served NR cells.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested.

elementList.name: Complete Information Request Indicator
elementList.description: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a gNB

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by a
  NG-RAN node. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: SUL Information
descriptionList:
This IE contains information about the SUL
carrier.

elementList.name: SUL Frequency Info
elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of NRARFCNs. Value is 3279165.

definitionList.name: NR Frequency Info
descriptionList:
The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier
frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or
for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

elementList.name: NR ARFCN
elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

elementList.name: NR Frequency Band
elementList.description: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

elementList.name: Supported SUL band Item
elementList.description: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of NRARFCNs. Value is 3279165.

Maximum no. of frequency bands supported for a
  NR cell. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: NR Transmission Bandwidth
descriptionList:
The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is
used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.

elementList.name: NR SCS
elementList.description: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

elementList.name: NR NRB
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)
elementList.description: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [24]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA ARFCN
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel
Number defines the carrier frequency used in an E-UTRAN cell for a given
direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

elementList.name: E-UTRA ARFCN
elementList.description: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [25].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of EARFCNs. Value is 262143.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Transmission Bandwidth
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Transmission Bandwidth IE
is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of
resource blocks "NRB" (TS 36.104 [25]). The values bw1,
bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks
"NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

elementList.name: E-UTRA Transmission Bandwidth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100,... , bw1)

definitionList.name: Number of Antenna Ports E-UTRA
descriptionList:
The Number of Antenna Ports E-UTRA
IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports supported by
an E-UTRA cell.

elementList.name: Number of Antenna Ports
elementList.description: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Multiband Info List
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Multiband Info List IE
contains the additional frequency band indicators that an E-UTRA cell belongs
to listed in decreasing order of preference and corresponds to the MultiBandInfoList
specified in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Frequency Band Indicator
elementList.description: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [27, table 5.5-1]

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of frequency bands that an
  E-UTRA cell belongs to. The value is 16.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA PRACH Configuration
descriptionList: This IE indicates the E-UTRA PRACH resources used in an E-UTRA neighbour cell.

elementList.name: RootSequenceIndex
elementList.description: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration
elementList.description: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: HighSpeedFlag
elementList.description: "true" corresponds to Restricted set and "false" to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: PRACH-FrequencyOffset
elementList.description: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [26]

elementList.name: PRACH-ConfigurationIndex
elementList.description: See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [26]

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the EUTRA-Mode-Info
  IE in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE is set to the value
  "TDD".

definitionList.name: MBSFN Subframe Allocation E-UTRA
descriptionList:
The MBSFN Subframe Allocation E-UTRA
IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the
radio frame allocation period as
specified for the MBSFN-SubframeConfig IE TS 36.331 [14].

definitionList.name: Global NG-RAN Cell Identity
descriptionList:
This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA
Cell Identity.

definitionList.name: Connectivity Support
descriptionList:
The Connectivity Support IE is used
to indicate the connectivity supported by a NR cell.

definitionList.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the resources allocated
for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as
protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA   NR
Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List
elementList.description: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List Item
elementList.description: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.

elementList.name: Resource Type
elementList.description: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

elementList.name: Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint
elementList.description: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value "0" indicates "resource not protected", value "1" indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs. is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern
elementList.description: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time Pattern
elementList.description: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time-periodicity
elementList.description: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Start Time
elementList.description: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

elementList.name: PDCCH Region Length
elementList.description: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. protected resource patterns. Value
  is 16.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the intended data traffic
resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resources
descriptionList:
The Data Traffic Resources IE
indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell
Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resources
elementList.description: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node s subframe 0 in a receiving node s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

definitionList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
descriptionList:
The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE
indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource
Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.

elementList.name: Subframe Type
elementList.description: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value 0 indicates "regular subframe". Value 1 indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node s subframe 0 in a receiving node s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

definitionList.name: MR-DC Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList:
The MR-DC Resource Coordination
Information IE is used to coordinate resource utilisation between the
M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: CHOICE NG-RAN Node Resource Coordination Information
E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information
elementList.description: E-UTRA resource coordination information

elementList.name: NR Resource Coordination Information
elementList.description: NR resource coordination information

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Resource Configuration
Information IE indicates LTE resource allocation at ng-eNB used at the gNB
to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN-node and S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: EUTRA Cell ID
elementList.description: This IE indicates the sPCell.

elementList.name: UL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: DL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node s subframe 0 in a receiving node s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the assumed sPCell.

definitionList.name: NR Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList:
The NR Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the ng-eNB sPCell
which are not available for use by the ng-eNB and is used at the ng-eNB to coordinate resource utilisation between
the gNB and the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the sPCell.

elementList.name: UL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node s subframe 0 in a receiving node s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: DL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node s subframe 0 in a receiving node s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: EUTRA Cell ID
elementList.description: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Coordination Assistance
Information IE is provided by the ng-eNB and used by the gNB to determine
further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: NR Coordination Assistance Information
descriptionList:
The NR Coordination Assistance
Information IE is provided by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine
further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: NE-DC TDM Pattern
descriptionList:
The NE-DC TDM Pattern IE is provided
by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine UL/DL
reference configuration indicating the time during which a UE configured with
NE-DC is allowed to transmit.

elementList.name: Subframe Assignment
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6)
elementList.description: Indicates DL/UL subframe configuration where sa0 points to Configuration 0, sa1 to Configuration 1 etc. as specified in TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: Harq Offset
elementList.description: Indicates a HARQ subframe offset that is applied to the subframes designated as UL in the associated subframe assignment, see TS 36.331 [14]

definitionList.name: Interface Instance Indication
descriptionList:
The Interface Instance Indication
identifies the interface instance the XnAP message is destined for.

NOTE:      The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated
with an Xn-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface
instance.

definitionList.name: Configured TAC Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates that in a NR cell served
by the gNB, the TAC with which this IE is associated, is only configured but
not broadcast.

NOTE:      This IE is defined in accordance to the
possibility foreseen in TS 38.331 [10] to not broadcast the TAC if the NR cell
only supports PSCell/SCell functionality.

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList:
The Message Type IE uniquely
identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, )

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Cause IE is to
indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice(s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice(s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, , UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, )

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, )

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is
sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been
comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When
applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or
were missing.

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of IE errors allowed to be reported
  with a single message. The Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits
delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided
by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum
or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be
applied to a QoS flow.

elementList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Reflective QoS Attribute
elementList.description: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Additional QoS flow Information
elementList.description: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise.

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS
Flow for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Notification Control
elementList.description: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN
resource.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

definitionList.name: Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE defines QoS
characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and
uplink.

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

definitionList.name: Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI
for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Packet Error Rate
elementList.description: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Delay Critical
elementList.description: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS
  Flow Level QoS Parameters IE.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Identifier
descriptionList:
This IE
identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: Packet Loss Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS
flow.

elementList.name: Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

definitionList.name: Packet Delay Budget
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.

definitionList.name: Packet Error Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for
a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Scalar
elementList.description: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.

definitionList.name: Averaging Window
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Averaging Window for
a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Unit: ms.

definitionList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst
Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Unit: byte,

definitionList.name: NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
descriptionList:
The NG-RAN
node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the
NG-RAN node.

The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401
[2].

NOTE:     If Xn-C signalling transport is shared
among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN
node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated
with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

definitionList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is
applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink
and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to
the NG-RAN.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: PDU Session ID
descriptionList:
This IE identifies
a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified
in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: PDU Session Type
descriptionList:
This IE defines
the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: TAI Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of TAIs
supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Broadcast TAC

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN

elementList.name: TAI Slice Support List
elementList.description: Supported S-NSSAIs per TA

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of TACs supported by an NG-RAN
  node. Value is 256.

Maximum no. of PLMNs supported by an NG-RAN
  node. Value is 12.

definitionList.name: S-NSSAI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: Slice Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of supported
slices.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of signalled slice support items.
  Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority
descriptionList:
The Index
to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local
configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of
inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501
[7].

definitionList.name: GUAMI
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Globally Unique AMF
Identifier (GUAMI) as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: Target Cell Global ID
descriptionList:
This IE contains either an NR CGI or an
E-UTRA CGI.

definitionList.name: AMF UE NGAP ID
descriptionList:
This IE is defined in TS 38.413 [5] and
used to uniquely identify the UE association over the
source side NG interface instance.

definitionList.name: SCG Configuration Query
descriptionList:
The SCG Configuration Query IE is used
to request the S-NG-RAN node to provide current SCG configuration.

definitionList.name: RLC Mode
descriptionList:
The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC
Mode used for a DRB.

definitionList.name: Transport Layer Address
descriptionList:
This IE is
defined to contain an IP address.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This element is used to provide the
transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane
transport. In this release it
corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20].

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

definitionList.name: CP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This element is used to provide the
transport layer information associated with NG or Xn control plane
transport.

definitionList.name: Masked IMEISV
descriptionList:
This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a
terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.

elementList.name: Masked IMEISV
elementList.description: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [22] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

definitionList.name: DRB ID
descriptionList:
This IE
contains the DRB ID.

definitionList.name: DL Forwarding
descriptionList:
This element indicates a proposal for
forwarding of downlink packets.

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Accepted
descriptionList:
This element indicates that data forwarding
was accepted.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the
12-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bits long Hyper Frame
Number.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the
18-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 14 bits long Hyper Frame
Number.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Area
descriptionList:
The RAN Paging
Area IE defines the paging area within a PLMN for RAN paging a UE
in RRC_INACTIVE state.

elementList.name: NG-RAN Cell Identity
elementList.description: In this version of the specification, the RAN paging area should contain NG-RAN cells of the same RAT type.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of cells in a RAN notification area. Value is 32.

Maximum no. of RAN area
  IDs in a RAN notification area. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: RAN Area ID
descriptionList: This IE defines the RAN Area ID.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

definitionList.name: UE Context ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to address a UE Context within an NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: I-RNTI
elementList.description: NOTE: How the new NG-RAN node is able to resolve the old NG-RAN ID from the I-RNTI is a matter of proper configuration in the old and new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Allocated C-RNTI
elementList.description: Temporary C-RNTI allocated to the UE by the cell where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed, contained in the MAC RAR as defined in TS 38.321 [35] or in TS 36.321 [36].

elementList.name: Access PCI
elementList.description: The cell PCI where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed.

elementList.name: C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message (TS 38.331 [10]) or RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message (TS 36.331 [14]).

definitionList.name: Assistance Data for RAN Paging
descriptionList: This IE provides assistance information for RAN paging.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Attempt Information
descriptionList:
This IE includes information related to the
RAN paging attempt over Xn.

elementList.name: Paging Attempt Count
elementList.description: Number of the RAN paging attempt.

elementList.name: Intended Number of Paging Attempts
elementList.description: Intended number of RAN paging attempts.

elementList.name: Next Paging Area Scope
elementList.description: Indicates whether the RAN paging area scope will change at next RAN paging attempt.

definitionList.name: UE RAN Paging Identity
descriptionList:
The IE
defines the UE Identity for RAN paging a UE in RRC_INACTIVE.

definitionList.name: Paging Priority
descriptionList:
This
information element contains an indication of the priority to be considered for
the paging request.

elementList.name: Paging Priority
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (PrioLevel1, PrioLevel2, PrioLevel3, PrioLevel4, PrioLevel5, PrioLevel6, PrioLevel7, PrioLevel8, ...)
elementList.description: Lower value codepoint indicates higher priority.

definitionList.name: Delivery Status
descriptionList:
This IE provides the delivery status of RRC
PDUs provided by RRC Transfer message.

elementList.name: Delivery Status
elementList.description: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in TS 38.323 [11].

definitionList.name: I-RNTI
descriptionList:
The I-RNTI
is defined for allocation in an NR or E-UTRA serving cell as a reference to a
UE Context within an NG-RAN node. The I-RNTI is partitioned into two parts, the
first part identifies the NG-RAN node that allocated the I-RNTI and the second
part identifies the UE context stored in this NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: I-RNTI full
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 40 bits (refer to I-RNTI-Value IE in TS 38.331 [10] and I-RNTI IE in TS 36.331 [14]).

elementList.name: I-RNTI short
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 24 bits (refer to ShortI-RNTI-Value IE in TS 38.331 [10] and ShortI-RNTI IE in TS 36.331 [14]).

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Information
descriptionList:
This information element indicates how the
location information should be reported.

elementList.name: Event Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( report upon change of serving cell, report UE moving presence into or out of the Area of Interest, , report upon change of serving cell and Area of Interest)

definitionList.name: Area of Interest Information
descriptionList:
This IE
contains indicates the Area of Interest information,
which may contain multiple Areas of Interest, as specified in TS 23.502 [13].

elementList.name: List of TAIs in Area of Interest
TAI in Area of Interest Item
List of Cells in Area of Interest
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined with SA2.

elementList.name: List of Global NG-RAN Nodes in Area of Interest
Global NG-RAN Node in Area of Interest Item

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Areas of Interest. Value is 64.

Maximum no. of tracking
  areas in an Area of Interest. Value is 16.

Maximum no. of cells in an Area of Interest.
  Value is 256.

Maximum no. of global NG-RAN nodes in an Area
  of Interest. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList:
The UE Security Capabilities IE
defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the
UE.

elementList.name: NR Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, "second bit" 128-NEA1, "third bit" 128-NEA2, "fourth bit" 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates support and value 0 indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: NR Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, "second bit" 128-NIA1, "third bit" 128-NIA2, "fourth bit" 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates support and value 0 indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, "second bit" 128-EEA1, "third bit" 128-EEA2, "fourth bit" 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates support and value 0 indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, "second bit" 128-EIA1, "third bit" 128-EIA2, "fourth bit" 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates support and value 0 indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

definitionList.name: AS Security Information
descriptionList:
The AS Security
Information IE is used to generate the key material to
be used for AS security with the UE.

elementList.name: Key NG-RAN Star
elementList.description: KNG-RAN* defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: Next Hop Chaining Count
elementList.description: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.501 [28]

definitionList.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
descriptionList:
The S-NG-RAN node Security Key
IE is used to apply security in the S-NG-RAN node as defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
elementList.description: The S-KSN which is provided by the M-NG-RAN node, see TS 33.501 [28].

definitionList.name: Security Indication
descriptionList:
This IE contains the user plane integrity
protection indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates
the requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for the corresponding
PDU session, respectively. Additionally, this IE contains the maximum integrity
protected data rate values (UL and DL) per UE for integrity protected DRBs.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
elementList.description: If present, this IE contains the values received from the CN for the overall UE capability. This IE may be ignored by the SN in the case of dual connectivity.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Integrity
  Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set
  to "required" or "preferred".

definitionList.name: Mobility Restriction List
descriptionList:
This IE defines roaming or access
restrictions for subsequent mobility actions for which the NR-RAN provides
information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g.,
handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for
assigning proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE,
it shall overwrite previously received restriction information. NG-RAN
behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Equivalent PLMNs
elementList.description: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of equivalent PLMNs as defined in TS 24.501 [30]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

elementList.name: RAT Restrictions
elementList.description: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: RAT Restriction Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 2-7 are reserved for future use.

elementList.name: Forbidden Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the forbidden TAI.

elementList.name: Service Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the allowed TAI.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI.

elementList.name: Last E-UTRAN PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Indicates the E-UTRAN PLMN ID from where the UE formerly handed over to 5GS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to EPS.

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restriction for serving PLMN
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC for the Serving PLMN as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restriction for Equivalent PLMNs
PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Includes any of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which CN Type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restriction
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC or to 5GC for this PLMN.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of equivalent PLMNs. Value is 15.
Maximum no. of allowed PLMNs. Value is 16.

Maximum no. of forbidden Tracking Area Codes.
  Value is 4096.

Maximum no. of allowed or not allowed Tracking
  Areas. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Xn Benefit Value
descriptionList:
The Xn Benefit Value IE indicates
the quantified benefit of the signalling connection.

elementList.name: Xn Benefit Value
elementList.description: Value 1 indicates lowest benefit, and 8 indicates highest benefit.

definitionList.name: Trace Activation
descriptionList:
This IE
defines parameters related to a trace activation.

elementList.name: NG-RAN Trace ID
elementList.description: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.2.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (last 2 octets).

elementList.name: Interfaces To Trace
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates should be traced . Value 0 indicates should not be traced .

elementList.name: Trace Depth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, )
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [23].

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [23]

definitionList.name: Time To Wait
descriptionList:
This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting
times.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Notification Control Indication Info
descriptionList:
This IE provides information about QoS
flows of a PDU Session Resource for which notification control has been
requested.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Request Reporting Reference ID
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Request Reporting
Reference ID and is used for UE presence in Area of Interest reporting as
specified in TS 23.502 [13].

definitionList.name: User plane traffic activity report
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate user plane
traffic activity.

elementList.name: User plane traffic activity report
elementList.description: "re-activated" is only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

definitionList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate that lower
layer resources  presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is
set to "release lower layers", SDAP entities, PDCP entities, Xn-U bearer resources, NG-U bearer
resources and UE context information shall be kept.

elementList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, ...)
elementList.description: "re-establish lower layers" is only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated.

definitionList.name: RRC Resume Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the RRC Resume Cause
IE is to indicate to the old NG-RAN node the reason for the RRC Connection
Resume as received from the UE in the ResumeCause defined in TS 36.331
[14] and TS 38.331 [10]. In this version of the specification, this is limited
to the case of RNA update.

definitionList.name: Priority Level
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Priority Level for a
QoS flow.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

definitionList.name: PDCP SN Length
descriptionList:
The PDCP SN Length IE is used to
indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer.

elementList.name: UL PDCP SN Length
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for UL.

elementList.name: DL PDCP SN Length
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for DL.

definitionList.name: UE History Information
descriptionList:
The UE History Information IE
contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state
prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [12].

NOTE:      The definition of this IE is aligned
with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: Last Visited Cell List
elementList.description: Most recent information is added to the top of this list

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of last visited cell information
  records that can be reported in the IE. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Last Visited Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited Cell Information may
contain cell specific information.

elementList.name: Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

elementList.name: Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 25.413 [32].

elementList.name: Last Visited GERAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

definitionList.name: Paging DRX
descriptionList: This IE indicates the RAN paging cycle as defined in TS 38.304 [33] and TS 36.304 [34].

definitionList.name: Security Result
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether the security
policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE is
performed or not.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

definitionList.name: UE Context Kept Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether the UE Context is
kept at the S-NG-RAN node in case of an M-NG-RAN node handover without S-NG-RAN
node change.

definitionList.name: PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS
flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink
direction and is provided at the Handover Preparation procedure to the target
NG-RAN node and at the Retrieve UE Context procedure to the new NG-RAN node as
received by the 5GC, during dual connectivity related procedures to the to the
S-NG-RAN node as decided by the M-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: LCID
descriptionList:
This IE uniquely identifies a logical
channel ID for the associated DRB.

elementList.name: LCID
elementList.description: Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Duplication Activation
descriptionList:
The Duplication Activation IE
indicates the initial status of UL PDCP duplication, i.e., whether UL PDCP
Duplication is activated or not.

definitionList.name: RRC Config Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the type of RRC
configuration used at the S-NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE
as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum IP Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL.

elementList.name: Maximum IP Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL.

definitionList.name: PDCP Change Indication
descriptionList:
The PDCP Change Indication IE is used for S-NG-RAN
node to either initiate the security key update or to request PDCP data
recovery in M-NG-RAN node. The PDCP Change Indication IE is also used for M-NG-RAN
node to request PDCP data recovery in S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (S-NG-RAN node key update required, PDCP data recovery required, ...)
elementList.description: S-NG-RAN node key update required indicates that the security key in S-NG-RAN node needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the M-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

elementList.name: Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node
elementList.description: The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the S-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

definitionList.name: UL Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured
for the corresponding node.

elementList.name: UL UE Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE contains Xn-U related information
related to a DRB.

elementList.name: Cell Group ID
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values "2" and "3" shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no of Secondary Cell Groups. Value is
  3.

definitionList.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
descriptionList:
This IE contains information on which level
activity notification shall be performed.

elementList.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (None, QoS Flow, PDU session, UE, )

definitionList.name: Number of DRB IDs
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the number of DRB IDs.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to
a DRB.

elementList.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

definitionList.name: RLC Status
descriptionList:
The RLC Status IE indicates about
the RLC configuration change included in the container towards the UE.

elementList.name: Reestablishment Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that following the change of the radio status, the RLC has been re-established.

definitionList.name: Expected UE Behaviour
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the behaviour of a UE
with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the NG-RAN node
in determining the optimum RRC connection time and to
help with the RRC_INACTIVE state transition and RNA configuration (e.g. size
and shape of the RNA).

elementList.name: Expected HO Interval
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, )
elementList.description: Indicates the expected time interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.

elementList.name: Expected UE Mobility
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is expected to be stationary or mobile.

elementList.name: Expected UE Moving Trajectory
elementList.description: Indicates the UE's expected geographical movement.

elementList.name: Expected UE Moving Trajectory Item
elementList.description: Includes list of visited and non-visited cells, where visited cells are listed in the order the UE visited them with the most recent cell being the first in the list. Non-visited cells are included immediately after the visited cell they are associated with.

elementList.name: Time Stayed in Cell
elementList.description: Included for visited cells and indicates the time a UE stayed in a cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095 seconds, this IE is set to 4095.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of cells of UE moving trajectory.
  Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Expected UE Activity Behaviour
descriptionList:
This IE indicates information about the
expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Expected Activity Period
elementList.description: If set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].

elementList.name: Expected Idle Period
elementList.description: If set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

elementList.name: Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information
elementList.description: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.

definitionList.name: AMF Region Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Global AMF Region IDs
of the AMF Regions to which the NG-RAN node belongs.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of AMF Regions an NG-RAN node can
  be connected to. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: TNL Association Usage
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
the usage of the TNL association.

elementList.name: TNL Association Usage
elementList.description: Indicates whether the TNL association is only used for UE associated signalling, or non-UE associated signalling, or both.

definitionList.name: Network Instance
descriptionList:
This IE provides the network instance to be
used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource
as described in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: PDCP Duplication Configuration
descriptionList:
The PDCP Duplication Configuration
IE indicates whether PDCP Duplication is configured or de-configured.

definitionList.name: Secondary RAT Usage Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the Secondary RAT resources used by a PDU Session with MR-DC as specified in
TS 37.340 [8].

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS
  flows allowed within one PDU session.
  Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Volume Timed Report List
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the data usage.

elementList.name: Start Timestamp
elementList.description: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

elementList.name: End Timestamp
elementList.description: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

elementList.name: Usage Count UL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

elementList.name: Usage Count DL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of time reporting periods. Value is
  2.

definitionList.name: Maximum IP Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum aggregate
data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
elementList.description: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

definitionList.name: UL Forwarding
descriptionList:
This element indicates a proposal for
forwarding of uplink packets.

definitionList.name: UE Radio Capability for Paging
descriptionList:
This IE contains paging specific UE Radio
Capability information.

elementList.name: UE Radio Capability for Paging of NR
elementList.description: Includes the RRC UERadioPagingInformation message as defined in TS 38.331 [18].

elementList.name: UE Radio Capability for Paging of E-UTRA
elementList.description: Includes the RRC UERadioPagingInformation message as defined in TS 36.331 [21].

definitionList.name: Common Network Instance
descriptionList:
This IE provides the common network
instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport
network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7] in a format common with 5GC.

definitionList.name: Default DRB Allowed
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate whether the SN
is allowed to configure the default DRB for a PDU session or not.

definitionList.name: Split Session Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether admitting the
requested resources results in a split PDU session.

definitionList.name: UL Forwarding Proposal
descriptionList:
This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding
of uplink packets.

definitionList.name: 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Mobility Restriction
List IE specified in TS 38.413 [5] as received by the NG-RAN from the 5GC.

elementList.name: 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container
elementList.description: The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the Mobility Restriction List IE specified in TS 38.413 [5].

definitionList.name: UE Specific DRX
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the UE specific paging
cycle as defined in TS 36.304 [34] and 38.304 [33].
